# Instructions

- I want you to create this mobile app that enables me to create Curriculum Vitaes and Resumes.
- The app should be able to create a PDF and MS Word file that can be saved to the device.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the resume.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the CV.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the cover letter.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the LinkedIn profile.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the GitHub profile.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the portfolio.
- The user will be able to add their own information to the resume.
- If the user gains let's say experience, they should add those experiences to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say education, they should add those educations to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say skills, they should add those skills to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say achievements, they should add those achievements to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say projects, they should add those projects to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say languages, they should add those languages to the resume and CV.
- If the user gains let's say references, they should add those references to the resume and CV.
- The user should be able to add their own information to the cover letter.
- The app should be offline first and authentication should be handled by firebase

# Additional Context

- Use BLoC pattern for state management and repository pattern for data handling.
- Use sqflite or any fast local database for offline storage.
- Use firebase authentication for user authentication.
- Use packages for generating PDF and MS Word files and downloading files to the device.
- The app should have a clean modern and user-friendly UI/UX design.
- The app should be built using Flutter framework.
- The app should be compatible with both Android, iOS, MacOS, Lnux and Windows (The last three will be looked into later but for now start with the first 2) platforms.
